quest_title: The equation of motion of a projectile are given by x = 36 t metre and 2y = 96 t – 9.8 t2 metre. The angle of projection is
explanation_txt:
\(\begin{array} { l } { x = 36 t \therefore v _ { x } = \cfrac { d x } { d t } = 36 \mathrm { m } / \mathrm { s } } \\ { y = 48 t - 4.9 t ^ { 2 } \therefore v _ { y } = 48 - 9.8 t } \\ { \text { At } t = 0, v _ { x } = 36 \text { and } v _ { y } = 48 \mathrm { m } / \mathrm { s } } \end{array}\)

\(\begin{array} { l } { \text { So, angle of projection } \theta = \tan ^ { - 1 } \left( \cfrac { v _ { y } } { v _ { x } } \right) = \tan ^ { - 1 } \left( \cfrac { 4 } { 3 } \right) } \\ { \text { Or } \theta = \sin ^ { - 1 } ( 4 / 5 ) } \end{array}\)

quest_title: Which of the following has acidic hydrogen ?
explanation_txt:
\(2 C H \equiv C H + 2 N a \rightarrow 2 C H \equiv C ^ { - } N a ^ { + } + H _ { 2 }\)

Reaction with sodium metal shows that hydrogen is acidic.

In ethyne, C is sp hybridised and is electronegative than Hydrogen so electron is pulled towards C atom and C becomes negatively charged and H+ are released.
question_plain_title: Which of the following has acidic hydrogen ?
explanation_plain_text:
Reaction with sodium metal shows that hydrogen is acidic.

In ethyne, C is sp hybridised and is electronegative than Hydrogen so electron is pulled towards C atom and C becomes negatively charged and H+ are released.

quest_title: A diwali rocket is ejecting 0.05 kg of gases per second at a velocity of 400 m/sec. The accelerating force on the rocket is
explanation_txt:
From Newton's second law, we have,

Force = rate of change of linear momentum

\(F = \cfrac{d}{dt}(mv)\)

As the velocity is constant and mass is not, (derivative of \(v\) is zero),

\(F = v \cfrac{d}{dt}(m)\)

\(F = 400 \times 0.05\)

\(\therefore F = 20 N\)
question_plain_title: A diwali rocket is ejecting 0.05 kg of gases per second at a velocity of 400 m/sec. The accelerating force on the rocket is
explanation_plain_text:

Force = rate of change of linear momentum

As the velocity is constant and mass is not, (derivative of is zero),

quest_title: With what speed must a ball be thrown down for it to bounce 10 m higher than original level?
explanation_txt:
\(\cfrac{1}{2} m v^{2}+m g h=m g(h+10)\)

or, \(\cfrac{1}{2} m v^{2}+m g h=m g h+m g \times 10\)
or, \(\cfrac{m v^{2}}{2}=m g \times 10\)
or, \(v=\sqrt{2 g \times 10}=\sqrt{200}=14.1 \mathrm{m} / \mathrm{s}\)

explanation_txt:

explanation_txt: \(\begin{aligned} \int \cfrac { d x } { 4 \cos ^ { 3 } 2 x - 3 \cos 2 x } & = \int \cfrac { d x } { \cos 6 x } = \int \sec 6 x d x \\ & = \cfrac { 1 } { 6 } \log ( \sec 6 x + \tan 6 x ) + c \end{aligned}\)

quest_title: An electron of energy 20eV comes in collision with Hydrogen atom in ground state. The hydrogen atom is excited thensubsequently return to ground state emitting a photon of 1.215\(\times\)10\({}^{-7}\)m. The velocity of scattered electrons is
explanation_txt:
\(\mathrm{E}=\mathrm{E}^{\prime}+\cfrac{\mathrm{hc}}{\lambda}\)
or, \(\cfrac{1}{2} \mathrm{mv}^{2}=\mathrm{E}-\cfrac{\mathrm{hc}}{\lambda}\)
or, \(v^{\prime}=\sqrt{\cfrac{2}{\mathrm{m}}\left(\mathrm{E}-\cfrac{\mathrm{hc}}{\lambda}\right)}\)
\(\begin{aligned} v^{\prime}=& \sqrt{\cfrac{2}{9.1 \times 10^{-31}}\left(20 \times 1.6 \times 10^{-19}-\cfrac{6.62 \times 10^{34} \times 3 \times 10^{8}}{1.216 \times 10^{-7}}\right)} \\ &=1.86 \times 10^{6} \mathrm{m} / \mathrm{s} \end{aligned}\)

quest_title: Equation of the line passing through (–1,1) and perpendicular to the line \(2 x + 3 y + 4 = 0 \) is
explanation_txt:
The slope of \(2 x + 3 y + 4 = 0 \) is \(- \cfrac { 2 } { 3 }\).

Now the equation of line passing through (-1,1) is \(y - 1 = m ( x + 1 )\)

But \(m = - \cfrac { 1 } { - 2 / 3 } = \cfrac { 3 } { 2 }\)

quest_title: A particle of mass m moving eastward with a speed v collides with another particle of the same mass moving northward with the same speed v. The two particles coalesce on collision. The new particle of mass 2m will move in the north-easterly direction with a velocity
explanation_txt:
Initial momentum of the system

\(\vec { P } _ { i } = m \hat { i } + m \hat { v }\)

\(\left| \vec { P } _ { i } \right| = \sqrt { 2 } m v\)

Final momentum of the system = 2mV

By the law of conservation of momentum

\(\sqrt { 2 } m v = 2 m V \Rightarrow V = \cfrac { v } { \sqrt { 2 } }\)
question_plain_title: A particle of mass m moving eastward with a speed v collides with another particle of the same mass moving northward with the same speed v. The two particles coalesce on collision. The new particle of mass 2m will move in the north-easterly direction with a velocity
explanation_plain_text:
Initial momentum of the system

Final momentum of the system = 2mV

By the law of conservation of momentum

quest_title: The magnification power of astronomical telescope in normal adjustment is 12 and distance between objective & eye piece is 156cm. Then focal length of objective is
explanation_txt:
\(\mathrm{m}=\cfrac{\mathrm{f}_{\mathrm{o}}}{\mathrm{f}_{\mathrm{e}}}\)
or, \(\mathrm{f}_{\mathrm{e}}=\cfrac{\mathrm{f}_{\mathrm{o}}}{\mathrm{m}}=\cfrac{\mathrm{f}_{\mathrm{o}}}{12}\)
\(\mathrm{f}_{\mathrm{o}}+\mathrm{f}_{\mathrm{e}}=156\)
or, \(\mathrm{f}_{\mathrm{a}}+\cfrac{\mathrm{f}_{\mathrm{o}}}{12}=156\)
or, \(\mathrm{f}_{\mathrm{o}}=\cfrac{156 \times 12}{13}=144 \mathrm{cm}\)

quest_title: In two separate experiments the neutral points due to two small magnets are at a distance of r and 2r in broad side-on position. The ratio of their magnetic moments will be
explanation_txt:
At broad side-on position \(B = \cfrac { M } { d ^ { 3 } }\)

\(\therefore \cfrac { M _ { 1 } } { d _ { 1 } ^ { 3 } } = \cfrac { M _ { 2 } } { d _ { 2 } ^ { 3 } } \text { or } \cfrac { M _ { 1 } } { r ^ { 3 } } = \cfrac { M _ { 2 } } { 8 r ^ { 3 } } \text { or } \cfrac { M _ { 1 } } { M _ { 2 } } = \cfrac { r ^ { 3 } } { 8 r ^ { 3 } } = \cfrac { 1 } { 8 }\)
question_plain_title: In two separate experiments the neutral points due to two small magnets are at a distance of r and 2r in broad side-on position. The ratio of their magnetic moments will be
explanation_plain_text: At broad side-on position

quest_title: If two solution of different concentrations in the same solvent are separated by semipermeable membrane the solvent flows from
ans1_txt: \(\quad\)The solution of higher concentration to that of lower concentration
ans2_txt: \(\quad\)the solution of higher osmotic pressure to that lower osmotic pressure.
ans3_txt: \(\quad\)the solution of lower concentration to that of higher concentration
ans4_txt: \(\quad\)The solution of lower vapour pressure to that of higher vapour pressure.
question_plain_title: If two solution of different concentrations in the same solvent are separated by semipermeable membrane the solvent flows from
ans1_plain_text: The solution of higher concentration to that of lower concentration
ans2_plain_text: the solution of higher osmotic pressure to that lower osmotic pressure.
ans3_plain_text: the solution of lower concentration to that of higher concentration
ans4_plain_text: The solution of lower vapour pressure to that of higher vapour pressure.

quest_title: The length of the transverse axis of a hyperbola is 7 and it passes through the point (5, –2). The equation of the hyperbola is :
explanation_txt:
Let the equation be \( \cfrac {x^2 } { a^2} - \cfrac { y^2} {b^2} = 1 \)

Since transverse axis is 7, \(a=7/2\).

Then equation becomes: \( \cfrac {4x^2 } { 49} - \cfrac { y^2} {b^2} = 1 \)

Since \( (5,-2) \) satisfies, \( \cfrac {4 \times 25 } { 49} - \cfrac { 4} {b^2} = 1 \)

Simplifying, \( b^2 = \cfrac{196}{51} \)

Thus euation is \( \cfrac {4 x^2} { 49} - \cfrac { 51y^2} {196} = 1 \)

quest_title: IUPAC name of acetyl salicylic acid is
explanation_txt:
Salicyclic acid is benzoic with hydroxyl group in second carbon.

So 2-acetoxy benzoic acid or 2-hydroxybenzoic acid
